p: Overall, a 2019 study of green financial development since 2011 concluded that ‘the degree of green financial development in China is relatively low at present’ (He et al. 2019, 979). China’s government has estimated that the green credit provided by the 21 ‘major financial institutions in banking’ in China reached around 7.51 trillion yuan by the end of 2016 or around 8.83 per cent of all loans (PRC 2018, 157). There is also evidence that green finance has developed unevenly in China, with a gap between the more prosperous coastal cities and provinces and inland regions (Liu et al. 2020). The process of aligning finance flows within China with the Article 2.1c goal remains at an early stage, and the absence of a taxonomy-like tool of general application (as opposed to a green bond catalogue) may impede whole-of-economy transformation of finance flows. Evidently, however, the 30/60 targets are providing new impetus, and further initiatives can be expected.
